title: ERROR mlflow.cli: Could not find main among entry points [] or interpret main as a runnable script Supported script file extensions: ['.py', '.sh'] ===
body:
Hi there,

I'm trying to use mlflow to run multiple experiments asynchronously using an MLproject file in a docker container which for now I'm running locally.

My MLproject file looks like this:

name: active-learner
docker_env:
  image: mlflow/active-learning

entry_points:
  main:
    parameters:
      task_name: {type: str}
      data_dir: path
      test_size: {type: int}
      train_sample_size: {type: int}
      sampling_technique: {type: str}
      estimator: {type: str}
      query_strategy: {type: str}
      n_queries: {type: int}
      methods: {type: str}
      output_dir: path
      batch_size: {type: int, default: 3}
    command: "python train.py \
    --task_name {task_name} \
    --data_dir {data_dir} \
    --test_size {test_size} \
    --train_sample_size {train_sample_size} \
    --estimator {estimator} \
    --sampling_technique {sampling_technique} \
    --query_strategy {query_strategy} \
    --n_queries {n_queries} \
    --methods {methods} \
    --output_dir {output_dir} \
    --batch_size {batch_size}"

Here train.py contains the main function. However, I keep getting this issue while I'm running mlflow run on CLI or using another script file with mlflow.projects.run(github_URI) for multiple runs. I've looked up all possible fixes I can get but nothing seems to work on my end. Any help would be appreciated!!
